metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6991 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A classic Stack-based buffer overflow exists in the zmLoadUser() function in zm_user.cpp of the zmu binary in ZoneMinder through 1.32.3, allowing an unauthenticated attacker to execute code via a long username.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> the patch I saw looked like it introduced a memory leak ccdm94> commit 6d7660cd fixes the memory leak

criterions.comment: zoneminder: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
